page.title: 06Types of Farming in Sydling
page.content: All of the farms keep livestock, cows, young heifers, calves, sheep and Court Farm is mainly used for stock breeding. Mr Millar, the farmer, specializes in crossing Charalaise with Fresian to improve milk & meat quotas. Sheep farming is on the increase now. The crops grown are hay, wheat, rape, beet and oats. Up Sydling Farm is the most modern now of all the farms and is refered to by the older farmers as a "Factory farm". The soil is mostly chalk downland but there are patches of good soil. The farmers generally seem to do very well and take good care of their land.
